properties.name: 1. Manchar Lake
properties.note: The largest freshwater lake in Pakistan. Its surface area fluctuates significantly with the monsoon season.

properties.name: 2. Keenjhar (Kalri) Lake
properties.note: The largest **man-made** lake in Pakistan, formed by linking two natural depressions (Sonehri and Keenjhar). It is a vital source of drinking water for Karachi and Thatta.

properties.name: 3. Langh Lake & Wildlife Sanctuary
properties.note: A wildlife sanctuary located near Hamal Lake in the Qambar Shahdadkot District. Known for its avian fauna diversity.

properties.name: 4. Kalan Kar Lake (Desert)
properties.note: A lake in the Umerkot and Sanghar districts, spread across barrage and desert lands. It has a reported maximum length of 31 km. (Source: Research/Wiki)

properties.name: 5. Nareri Lake (Lagoon)
properties.note: An important Ramsar **lagoon** in the Badin coastal belt and lower Indus delta region. It serves as a source of water discharge for the Sir Creek area. (Area Source: Living Indus)

properties.name: 6. Kuth Lake
properties.note: The largest lake in the Dubbi area (1,600,000 $	ext{m}^2$). It is fed by the Mirwah canal via the 'Kadan Wari Kund' and is known for fish and birds. (Area approximated from 1600 sq m source).

properties.name: 7. Bakri Waro Lake
properties.note: Bakri Waro means 'Owner of Goat.' This beautiful lake features the 100-meter tall 'Bakri Waro Daro' mound on its southern bank and is known for migratory birds. (Area approximated from 1,200,000 $	ext{m}^2$ source).

properties.name: 8. Wadi Sim Lake
properties.note: The deepest lake in its area (4.5m), located east of the main lake cluster. It is a salt water lake. (Area approximated from 700,000 $	ext{m}^2$ source).

properties.name: 9. Jamal Shah Lake
properties.note: Famous for water believed to treat skin diseases. The shrine and tomb of Pir Jamal Shah are located on its bank. (Area approximated from 600,000 $	ext{m}^2$ source).

properties.name: 10. Tal Lake
properties.note: Named after 'Tal' (gross) grass that grows in its water. Situated in the north of the lake cluster near Village Tali. (Area approximated from 800,000 $	ext{m}^2$ source).

properties.name: 11. Wero Lake
properties.note: Located closest to Dubbi Village. It is one of the smaller, shallower lakes in the cluster. (Area approximated from 500,000 $	ext{m}^2$ source).

properties.name: 12. Ganairo Lake
properties.note: The most eastern lake in this area, known for a large amount of salt under the water, which locals dig for home use.

properties.name: 13. Pateji Lake (Dhand)
properties.note: A 'Dhand' (shallow lake/depression) in the Badin District. It is one of the coastal wetlands in the region. (Source: ResearchGate/World Bank)

properties.name: 14. Haleji Lake
properties.note: A former reservoir, now a wildlife sanctuary and Ramsar Site, serving as an important habitat for waterbirds.

properties.name: 15. Hadero Lake
properties.note: A brackish water wetland, known for migratory birds.

properties.name: 16. Drigh Lake
properties.note: A small, slightly brackish Ramsar site and Wildlife Sanctuary with extensive reed marshes, important for breeding and wintering waterbirds. (Area Source: Ramsar)

properties.name: 17. Hamal Lake
properties.note: Located in the Kamber Shahdadkot District; its area fluctuates widely due to water inflow from the Main Nara Valley Drain (MNVD).
